body:
Comment 2: 
@jasaugusto,

As far as I can see, your CPU failed to execute program instruction (it thinks it is
illegal). I suspect, your CPU is old and cannot execute SSE2 instructions that supplied
binaries have. These make programs run much faster, and most computers have them this
days. So, you are out of luck here - you cannot run pre-built binaries.

But, you can built Go yourself, if you like. The build process should be able to
determine that your CPU does not support SSE2 instructions, and build everything
accordingly.

Here is http://golang.org/doc/install/source general instruction. Please, tell us how
you went.

Alex
_Labels changed: added **os-windows**._ _Status changed to **WaitingForReply**._
